summary: This document is an email chain between a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and attorney Jeff Jocks regarding a subpoena to the Interlochen Center for the Arts. The prosecutors are seeking records of any tuition payments made by Jeffrey Epstein or his entities for students at Interlochen. The attorney for Interlochen confirms they have no such records, as they only keep payment information for seven years.

persons.name: Jeff Jocks
persons.role: Attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Attorney from Sondee, Racine & Doren, PLC communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding a subpoena for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. He confirms Interlochen has no records of payments by Epstein.

persons.name: George B. Donnini
persons.context: Copied on an email from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts. He is thanked for his assistance alongside Jeff Jocks.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena seeks records of any tuition payments made by him or his entities for students at the Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena seeks records related to her, alongside Jeffrey Epstein, from the Interlochen Center for the Arts.

connections.description: Both are attorneys involved in responding to the U.S. Attorney's Office subpoena on behalf of the Interlochen Center for the Arts.
Jocks, as attorney for Interlochen, is responding to a subpoena seeking records of payments by Epstein or his entities.
Both are named as subjects of the subpoena seeking records from Interlochen Center for the Arts.

events.title: Subpoena issued to Interlochen
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Prosecutor follow-up on tuition payments
events.description: A prosecutor follows up to confirm if Interlochen's document production included all records of any tuition payments made by Epstein or his entities for any students.

events.title: Attorney confirms no Epstein payment records
events.description: Attorney Jeff Jocks states Interlochen only keeps tuition payment information for seven years and has no records reflecting payments by Epstein or Epstein entities.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts (Traverse City, Michigan 49684)
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
310 West Front Street, Suite 300, Traverse City, Michigan 49684
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a subpoena to the Interlochen Center for Arts seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
A key line of inquiry was whether Epstein or his entities made any tuition payments for students at Interlochen.

The attorney for Interlochen, Jeff Jocks, confirmed the institution only keeps tuition payment records for seven years and that their files contained no records of payments by Epstein or his entities.
The email chain shows investigative efforts by prosecutors in 2020, following Epstein's 2019 death, regarding his financial activities and potential beneficiaries.
Multiple individuals in the U.S. Attorney's Office are involved in the correspondence, but their names are redacted in the released document.
